item.title: Time Course Analysis - Example workflow
item.description: # setwd("~/PROJECTS_WORK/projectnumber") library(knitr) opts_chunk$set(message=FALSE, error=FALSE, warning=FALSE, tidy=TRUE, tidy.opts=list(blank=FALSE), cache=TRUE, cache.lazy = FALSE, echo = TRUE, results = 'asis', fig.pos='H', fig.wide=TRUE, eval=FALSE) library(tidyverse) library(reshape2) library(pander) library(grid) library(VennDiagram) library(DESeq2) library(ImpulseDE2) library(splines) library(pheatmap) library(TCseq) library(biomaRt) library(org.Hs.eg.db) library(TxDb.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg19.knownGene) library(pander) library(eulerr) library(qvalue) library(clusterProfiler) library(org.Hs.eg.db) library(DOSE) # ddsHTSeq <- readRDS("PXXX_ddsHTSeq_timeCourse_spline.RDS") # sampleTable <- readRDS("PXXX_sampleTable_metadata.RDS") # objectImpulseDE2 <- readRDS("PXXX_objectImpulseDE2.RDS") Preparing Data Loading HTSeq Counts This is run on the cluster, then an RDS file is analysed locally.
